intro: Anonychium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf anonychium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, featuring lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
